API reference¶

vntree is a simple tree data structure coded in Python.

  • Node
  • NodeAttr
  • TreeAttr

Node¶

class vntree.Node(name=None, parent=None, data=None, treedict=None, vnpkl_fpath=None)[source]¶

Class for creating vntree nodes.

Parameters:
  • name (str or None) – node name
  • parent (Node or None) – The parent node of this node.
  • data (dict or None) – Dictionary containing node data.
  • treedict (dict or None) – Dictionary specifying a complete tree.
_ancestors¶

Attribute referencing the tree ancestors of the node instance.

Returns:list of node ancestors in sequence, first item is the current node instance (self), the last item is root.
Return type:list of Node references
_coord¶

Attribute indicating the tree coordinates for this node.

The tree coordinates of a node are expressed as a tuple of the indices of the node and its ancestors, for example: A grandchild node with node path /root.name/root.childs[2].name/root.childs[2].childs[0].name would have coordinates (2,0). The root node _coord is an empty tuple: ()

Returns:the tree coordinates for this node.
Return type:tuple
_level¶

Attribute indicating the tree level for this node instance.

Note that the root node is defined as level 1.

Returns:the node level.
Return type:int
_path¶

Attribute indicating the absolute node path for this node.

Note that the absolute node path starts with a forward slash followed by the root node’s name: e.g: /root.name/child.name/grandchild.name Warning: it should be noted that use of _path assumes that sibling nodes have unique names. If unique node paths cannot be assured, use node attribute «_coord» instead.

Returns:The absolute node path for this node.
Return type:str
_root¶

Attribute referencing the root node of the tree.

Returns:the root node of the tree containing this instance.
Return type:Node
add_child(node)[source]¶

Add a child node to the current node instance.

Parameters:node (Node) – the child node instance.
Returns:The new child node instance.
Return type:Node
copy()[source]¶

Return a deep copy of the sub-tree rooted at this node instance.

Returns:Copy of the sub-tree rooted at this node instance.
Return type:Node
find_one_node(*keys, value, decend=True)[source]¶

Find a node on the branch of the instance with a keys=data item in the data dict.

Nested values are accessed by specifying the keys in sequence. e.g. node.get_data(“country”, “city”) would access node.data[“country”][“city”]

Parameters:
  • keys (str) – the data dict key(s) referencing the required value.
  • value – the value corresponding to keys. Note that value is a keyword-only argument.
  • decend (bool) – decend=True traverse down the branch sub-tree starting from self. decend=False traverse up the branch from self towards root.
Returns:

the first node found with keys=data in the data dict.
Return type:

Node or None
get_child_by_name(childname)[source]¶

Get a child node of the current instance by its name.

Parameters:childname (str) – the name of the required child node.
Returns:the first child node found with name childname.
Return type:Node or None
get_data(*keys)[source]¶

Get a value from the instance data dict.

Nested values are accessed by specifying the keys in sequence. e.g. node.get_data(“country”, “city”) would access node.data[“country”][“city”]

Parameters:keys (str) – the data dict keys referencing the required value.
Returns:the value accessed by keys in data.
get_node_by_coord(coord, relative=False)[source]¶

Get a node from a node coord.

Parameters:
  • coord (tuple or list) – the coordinates of the required node.
  • relative (bool) – True if coord is relative to the node instance, False for absolute coordinates.
Returns:

the node corresponding to coord.
Return type:

Node or None
get_node_by_path(path)[source]¶

Get a node from a node path.

Warning: use of this method assumes that sibling nodes have unique names, if this is not assured the get_node_by_coord method can be used instead.

Example with absolute node path:
node.get_node_by_path(‘/root.name/child.name/gchild.name’)
Example with relative node path:
node.get_node_by_path(‘child.name/gchild.name’)
Parameters:path (str) – the absolute node path, or the node path relative to the current node instance.
Returns:the node corresponding to path.
Return type:Node or None
classmethod openfile(filepath)[source]¶

Class method that opens (load) a vntree pickle file.

Parameters:filepath (str) – the file path for the pickle file.
Returns:root node of tree or False if failure.
Return type:Node or bool
remove_child(idx=None, *, name=None, node=None)[source]¶

Remove a child node from the current node instance.

Parameters:
  • idx (int) – Index of child node to be removed.
  • name (str) – The first child node found with «name» will be removed.
  • node (Node) – Child node to be removed.
Returns:

The node that has been removed, or False if not successful.
Return type:

Node or False
savefile(filepath=None)[source]¶

Save (dump) the tree in a pickle file.

Note that this method saves the complete tree even when invoked on a non-root node. It is recommended to use the extension .vnpkl for this type of file.

Parameters:filepath (str or None) – the file path for the pickle file. If filepath=None use self._vnpkl_fpath attribute, if set.
Returns:True if successful.
Return type:bool
set_data(*keys, value)[source]¶

Set a value in the instance data dict.

Parameters:
  • keys (str) – the data dict keys referencing the value in the data dict.
  • value – the value to be set in the data dict. Note that value is a keyword-only argument.
Returns:

True if successful.
to_texttree(indent=3, func=True)[source]¶

Method returning a text representation of the (sub-)tree rooted at the current node instance (self).

Parameters:
  • indent (int) – the indentation width for each tree level.
  • func (function or bool) – function returning a string representation for each node. e.g. func=lambda n: str(n._coord) would show the node coordinates. func=True node.name displayed for each node. func=False no node representation, just the tree structure is displayed.
Returns:

a string representation of the tree.
Return type:

str
tree_compare(othertree, vntree_meta=False)[source]¶

Compare the (sub-)tree rooted at self with another tree.

tree_compare converts the trees being compared into JSON string representations, and uses difflib.SequenceMatcher().ratio() to calculate a measure of the similarity of the strings.

Parameters:
  • othertree (Node) – the other tree for comparison.
  • vntree_meta (bool) – include private vntree metadata in comparison.
Returns:

similarity of the trees as a number between 0 and 1.
Return type:

float
classmethod yaml2tree(yamltree)[source]¶

Class method that creates a tree from YAML.

# Example yamltree data:
- !Node &root
name: “root node”
parent: null
data:
testpara: 111
- !Node &child1
name: “child node”
parent: *root
- !Node &gc1
name: “grand-child node”
parent: *child1
Parameters:yamltree (str) – a string of YAML describing the nodes in the tree, or the path to a file containing the data.
Returns:the root node of the tree.
Return type:Node

NodeAttr¶

class vntree.NodeAttr(ns=None, initial=None)[source]¶

Descriptor class for node attributes.

NodeAttr attributes are stored in the node instance data dictionary. This facilitates serialization and persistance of the tree.

Parameters:ns (str or None) – namespace for storing attribute in a nested dictionary in data. ns=None for top-level attributes.

TreeAttr¶

class vntree.TreeAttr(ns=None)[source]¶

Descriptor class for tree attributes. TreeAttr attribute values are stored in the root node data dictionary.

Storing an attribute in the root node of the tree ensures that the attribute can be found by all nodes in the tree. TreeAttr is a subclass of NodeAttr.

Parameters:ns (str or None) – namespace for attribute. ns=None for top-level attributes.
